alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, southwestern James City and northeastern Surry Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Surry. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Scotland around 210 PM EDT. Jamestown around 215 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Alliance and Governors Land. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
